title: Job Vacancies at APTECH
content:
APTECH is a Global career education company having a presence in 5 continents. APTECH currently operates successfully in over 1300 centers in 40 countries with presence in Nigeria for over 15 years. Due to current expansion and growth, we need career minded persons with capacity to deliver results.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)Software Faculty

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Deliver lectures and practical sessions on software development courses (Java, Python, C#, Web Development, Database Management) and Data Science.
	Design and evaluate assessments to measure student performance.
	Provide mentorship and academic support to students.
	Maintain class records, attendance, and progress reports.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2-5 years of experience.
	Strong understanding of programming concepts and modern frameworks.
	Good communication and presentation skills.
	Ability to teach both beginners and advanced learners.
	Experience with tools like Visual Studio, Eclipse, Git, and SQL Server is an advantage.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hassan@raptorstechnologies.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Networking & Cybersecurity Instructor

Job Location: Ajao Estate, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	We are seeking a highly competent Networking Instructor to join our Maryland center. The ideal candidate will be passionate about teaching and possess deep technical expertise in network infrastructure and security.


Key Responsibilities


	Instructional Delivery: Deliver effective teaching on assigned IT courses with a focus on practical, hands-on training.
	Mentorship: Offer guidance and support to students throughout their learning journey, creating a motivating environment.
	Assessment: Regularly evaluate student performance through assignments, live projects, and exams.
	Curriculum Updates: Stay current with industry trends and incorporate the latest tech advancements into teaching sessions.


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s degree or HND in Computer Science, IT, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years in teaching/training or equivalent industry experience in the relevant technologies.


Technical Skill Requirements:


	Certifications/Proficiency: CCNA, CCNP, Cyber Security, and Ethical Hacking.
	Systems: Red Hat System & Network Administration, CompTIA A+, and CompTIA N+.
	Cloud: Windows Azure Cloud Technologies.
	Hardware: Competence in configuring live Cisco devices (Routers, Switches, Wireless) and utilizing Cyber Security tools.


Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: manager.ajao@raptorstechnologies.com using "Networking Instructor - Maryland" as the subject of the mail.

Note: You may visit our center for more information: Address: 1/3B Asa Afariogun Street, Off Osolo Way, Ajao Estate, Lagos Or contact: 09037161890 / 09115015401.

 

 

3.) Software Engineer Instructor

Job Location: Ajao Estate, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a dynamic and highly skilled Software Engineer Instructor to join our global network. You will be responsible for training the next generation of IT professionals, delivering industry-standard curriculum, and mentoring students in modern software development practices.


Key Responsibilities


	Deliver high-quality classroom and practical instruction on software development.
	Guide students through project-based learning and real-world coding scenarios.
	Evaluate student performance and provide constructive feedback.
	Stay updated with the latest trends in the IT industry to ensure curriculum relevance.


Education & Experience


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc/HND in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field with 2 years of experience.
	Proven experience in software development or technical instruction.
	Strong communication and presentation skills.


Technical Requirements:


	Proficiency in Java, Python, C, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React, Spring, Django.
	Strong database management skills: SQL & MongoDB.
	Added Advantage: Practical knowledge of AI/ML, Data Science, and Cloud Computing.


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: manager.ajao@raptorstechnologies.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: You may visit our center for more information: Address: 1/3B Asa Afariogun Street, Off Osolo Way, Ajao Estate, Lagos Or contact: 09037161890 / 09115015401.

title: Job Openings at Joybridge HR Solutions
content:
Joybridge HR Solutions is a human resources consulting and management firm dedicated to helping organizations optimize their workforce strategies, improve employee engagement, and streamline HR processes. With a focus on delivering tailored solutions, Joybridge HR Solutions supports businesses in achieving their goals through effective talent management, compliance guidance, and HR best practices.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Client Service Executive

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description
     

            
    




	Our client is seeking a dedicated and customer-focused Client Service Executive to join our healthcare team.
	This role involves delivering exceptional customer service to patients and their families, managing billing processes, and ensuring a smooth patient experience.


Key Responsibilities
Patient Interaction and Support:


	Greet and assist patients, families, and visitors with professionalism and empathy.
	Address inquiries regarding hospital services, procedures, and policies.
	Guide patients through admission, discharge, and other hospital processes.


Billing and Financial Services:


	Ensure daily sales are reconciled with the EMR for proper accounting system.
	Account reconciliation on payment received and expenses incurred in the daily running.
	Ensure regular update of Admission bill and payment settlement before discharge
	Follow-up with debtor and ensure prompt payment
	Management of receivables from clients via Cash, Cheque, Direct Payment and Inter-switch.
	Ensuring all receivables are remitted to the account department.


Administrative Duties:


	Maintain accurate records of patient interactions and transactions.
	Update and manage patient data in hospital systems.
	Support the coordination of appointments, consultations, and other services.


Communication and Coordination:


	Act as a liaison between patients, families, and medical staff to ensure seamless communication.
	Collaborate with internal teams to address patient concerns promptly.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or relevant certification in Healthcare, Business, or a related field.
	1 - 2 years of experience in customer service
	Proficiency in using hospital management systems, microsoft office packages and billing software.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work flexible hours and in a shift-based schedule.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Must be available to resume immediately.
	Past experience in the healthcare sector is an advantage.
	Proximity to the Yaba location is an advantage.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 15th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: joybridgehrsolutions@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) HMO / Billing Officer

Job Location: Magodo Phase 2, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description


	Our client is looking for a HMO/Billing Officer who will be responsible for managing all activities related to Health Maintenance Organizations (HMOs), private billing, and corporate account transactions.


Key Responsibilities
HMO & Insurance Management:


	Register and verify patient HMO eligibility and benefits before service delivery.
	Liaise with HMO representatives for approvals, service codes, and pre-authorizations.
	Track, document, and manage all HMO-related treatments, investigations, and referrals.
	Ensure that all HMO claims are submitted accurately and on time.


Billing Operations:


	Prepare and issue invoices for HMO, private, and corporate clients.
	Accurately capture all billable services and consumables used by patients.
	Monitor and reconcile daily patient bills and revenue against services rendered.
	Identify and correct billing discrepancies before submission.


Claims Management:


	Compile, validate, and submit claims to HMOs and corporate clients promptly.
	Track the status of submitted claims and follow up on pending or rejected ones.
	Resubmit or rectify rejected claims with supporting documentation.
	Maintain proper documentation for all claims for audit and review purposes.


Payment Reconciliation:


	Reconcile payments received with claims submitted to ensure completeness and accuracy.
	Work closely with the finance team to ensure timely posting of payments and resolution of variances.
	Prepare periodic aging reports and outstanding claims summaries for management.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Maintain accurate records of patient accounts, invoices, HMO approvals, and payment remittances.
	Generate daily, weekly, and monthly billing and payment reports.
	Flag issues of non-payment or delayed remittances to the appropriate authority.
	Support audits by providing relevant billing documentation and reconciliations.


Relationship Management:


	Serve as the point of contact for all HMO-related inquiries and correspondence.
	Foster strong professional relationships with HMO and corporate account officers.
	Address complaints or issues from patients and clients related to billing.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related fields.
	1 - 2 years of minimum experience in HMO/Billing Officer role.
	Knowledge of HMO operations, health insurance codes, and billing procedures.
	Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Excel and EMR platforms.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: joybridgehrsolutions@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.)  Female Registered Nurse

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description


	Our client is seeking a dedicated and compassionate Female Registered Nurse to join our healthcare team in the ICU.
	The ideal candidate will provide exceptional patient care and ensure adherence to medical protocols.


Responsibilities


	Collaborate with the Chief Medical Officer and Nursing Supervisor to establish effective systems for delivering patient-centered care with compassion, dignity, and respect, resulting in positive health outcomes
	Administration of medications to patients according to the Doctor's prescription.
	Setting of Intramuscular and intravenous infusion (when the need arises).
	Perform wound care and assist physicians during procedures.
	Ensure the highest standard of evidence-based nursing care is delivered to all patients and their families.
	Act in accordance with the Nursing & Midwifery Council Code Standards of Conduct, performance and ethics for nurses.
	Record patient treatment plan, interventions, outcomes and plan revisions
	Monitor and document symptoms and changes in patients’ conditions promptly and notifying the medical officer of any development swiftly.
	Ensure proper storage of equipment and devices properly after use
	Accurate documentation of patient's medical information and vital signs.
	Monitoring and following-up with the house-keeper ensuring the wardis clean and tidy always.
	Ability to operate the patient monitor effectively monitoring the following parameters adequately ECG, Body Temperature, Oxygen saturation.
	Ensure the wards comply with all health and safety requirements.
	Develop collaborative and cooperative relationships with other healthcare professionals, and participate in professional and managerial meetings, liaising as appropriate.


Requirements


	Must be a Registered Nurse with 2-3 years of experience.
	Must have a valid practising license.
	Candidate must reside in Lagos, proximity to Yaba is an advantage.
	Have a good communciation skill.
	Experience in the ICU is an advantage.


Salary
N180,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 16th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: joybridgehrsolutions@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

Human Resource Officer Job at Silverado Properties




        
    

        
        Silverado Properties is a Lagos based Real Estate company that deals in construction, sales and rentals of properties. We also manage properties and facilities, design and supervise projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Recruiting, training and developing staff
	Making sure that staff get paid correctly and on time
	Pensions and benefits administration
	Approving job descriptions and advertisements
	Looking after the health, safety and welfare of all employees
	Organising staff training sessions and activities
	Monitoring staff performance and attendance
	Advising line managers and other employees on employment law and the employer's own employment policies and procedures
	Ensuring candidates have the right to work at the organisation
	Negotiating salaries, contracts, working conditions or redundancy packages with staff and representatives.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree / HND / Master's Degree with 5 - 15 years of work experience.


Key Skills:


	Commercial awareness
	Effective organisational skills
	Ability to form working relationships with people at all levels
	Teamwork skills
	Interpersonal skills
	Meticulous attention to detail
	Numerical skills
	IT skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bsrecruitslagos@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
